summaryText: Wow, what an incredible message from Pastor Travis Hearn about feeling overlooked! PT delivered a powerful sermon that speaks directly to anyone who has ever felt passed over, unseen, or forgotten. Using the story of David, he reminds us that just because we're overlooked by people doesn't mean we're overlooked by God. Sometimes, what feels like rejection is actually God's protection and preparation for something extraordinary! The most profound takeaway? God is hiding you, not to punish you, but to position you for something amazing. Pastor Travis shared personal stories that made the message feel so relatable - from being the last kid picked in basketball to struggling with his own calling. The sermon is a beautiful reminder that your time is coming, and God sees you even when others don't. He challenged us to keep growing in character, keep developing our skills, and keep our focus on God instead of comparing ourselves to others. If you've ever felt overlooked, this message is a powerful reminder: You are chosen, you are seen, and your time is coming!
mainPoints: Keep your focus on God, not comparison

versesMentioned.text: But you are a chosen people, a royal priesthood, a holy nation, God's special possession, that you may declare the praises of him who called you out of darkness into his wonderful light.
You are my hiding place; you will protect me from trouble and surround me with songs of deliverance.
Keep me as the apple of your eye; hide me in the shadow of your wings.

But the Lord said to Samuel, 'Do not consider his appearance or his height, for I have rejected him. The Lord does not look at the things people look at. People look at the outward appearance, but the Lord looks at the heart.'
This is to my Father's glory, that you bear much fruit, showing yourselves to be my disciples.
But the fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace, patience, kindness, goodness, faithfulness, gentleness and self-control. Against such things there is no law.
If the ax is dull and its edge unsharpened, more strength can be needed, but skill will bring success.
Let us not become weary in doing good, for at the proper time we will reap a harvest if we do not give up.
A heart at peace gives life to the body, but envy rots the bones.

Blessed is the man who trusts in the Lord, whose confidence is in him. He is like a tree planted by the water that sends out its roots by the stream. It does not fear when heat comes; its leaves are always green. It has no worries in a year of drought and never fails to bear fruit.

Monday.scripture: Psalm 139:16: 'Your eyes saw my unformed body; all the days ordained for me were written in your book before one of them came to be.'
Monday.focus: Understanding God's intentional plan for your life
Monday.action: Write down three areas where you feel overlooked. Pray and ask God to reveal His perspective on each situation. Journal any insights or impressions you receive.
Monday.prayer: Father, help me see myself through Your eyes. Reveal the areas where You are working in my life, even when I can't see it. Give me patience and trust in Your perfect timing. Amen.

Tuesday.scripture: Jeremiah 29:11: 'For I know the plans I have for you,' declares the Lord, 'plans to prosper you and not to harm you, plans to give you hope and a future.'
Tuesday.action: Identify one skill you want to develop. Create a specific, achievable goal for improving that skill this week. Commit to practicing it daily.
Tuesday.prayer: Lord, help me be faithful in the small things. Show me the skills and talents You've placed in me, and give me wisdom to develop them for Your glory. Amen.

Wednesday.scripture: Philippians 1:6: 'Being confident of this, that he who began a good work in you will carry it on to completion until the day of Christ Jesus.'
Wednesday.action: Do a personal character assessment. Write down one area of your character you want God to develop. Commit to being more intentional in that area.
Wednesday.prayer: God, reveal the areas of my character that need refinement. Give me humility to grow and the strength to become more like Jesus. Amen.

Thursday.scripture: Proverbs 3:5-6: 'Trust in the Lord with all your heart and lean not on your own understanding; in all your ways submit to him, and he will make your paths straight.'
Thursday.focus: Avoiding comparison and trusting God's unique path
Thursday.action: Take a social media fast for the day. Replace scrolling time with prayer and reflection on your personal journey with God.
Thursday.prayer: Father, guard my heart against comparison. Help me focus on the unique path You've designed specifically for me. Give me contentment and joy in Your plan. Amen.

Friday.scripture: Romans 8:28: 'And we know that in all things God works for the good of those who love him, who have been called according to his purpose.'
Friday.focus: Seeing challenges as opportunities for growth
Friday.action: Reflect on a current challenge. Write down three potential ways God might be using this situation to develop your character or skills.
Friday.prayer: Lord, give me spiritual eyes to see beyond my current circumstances. Help me trust that You are working all things together for my good. Amen.

Saturday.scripture: Isaiah 40:31: 'But those who hope in the Lord will renew their strength. They will soar on wings like eagles; they will run and not grow weary, they will walk and not be faint.'
Saturday.action: Create a 'faith journal' where you document moments of God's faithfulness. Write down promises you're believing God for and testimonies of His work in your life.
Saturday.prayer: God, renew my hope and strengthen my faith. Help me remember Your faithfulness in the past and trust You for my future. Refresh my spirit and help me wait expectantly. Amen.
